summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the forensic search of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The devices were seized during his arrest, from his New York residence, and from his private island, Little Saint James. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation. Electronic devices were seized from his person during his arrest and from his residences in New York and the Virgin Islands. The warrant seeks evidence of his violations and his co-conspirators.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. The search is authorized to find evidence of communications with her and her involvement in the subject offenses.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant on June 26, 2020.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses (sex trafficking, transportation of minors, enticement, and conspiracy).

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein and device seizure
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI, and two electronic devices (an iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Search of 9 East 71st Street, New York
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James, Virgin Islands
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices from various structures on the island.

events.title: Warrant issued for forensic search
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued this search warrant, authorizing the forensic examination of the 62 seized devices for evidence spanning 1994 to 2019.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Jeffrey Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: A total of 62 electronic devices were subject to the forensic search warrant: 2 from Epstein's person at arrest, 33 from his New York mansion, and 27 from his private island.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein and authorizes a search for evidence of communications with her.
The search was for evidence of violations including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. 1591), transportation of minors (2422), enticement to travel (2423), and conspiracy (371).
The authorized search period for evidence on the devices was extensive, covering 1994 through August 8, 2019.
The warrant details specific categories of evidence sought, including nude photos of teenage girls, travel records for victims, financial payments, and child erotica.
